intro: Epilobium valdiviense f. elatius, commonly known as the Valdivian willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, forested areas and along stream banks. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in clusters. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its erect stems and elongated inflorescences. This subspecies is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations and its adaptability to diverse soil conditions.
